recipesJson.name: Cucumis
recipesJson.author: Horsegame
recipesJson.description:
Disover the power of the Cucumis Genus. Experience the pinnacle of flavour as the Cucumis Sativus (Cucumber) and Cucumis Melo (Honeydew) dance in harmony, with an alluringly fresh minty, top note. waterfalls of juiciness from cactus and pear, all swimming together in a beautifully refreshing ice bath.

* TPA Peppermint = 1 drop per 10 mL

reviews.text: Weeeeow, that’s terrific! It’s just absolutely dripping with juiciness, maybe the juiciest juice I’ve EVER tried. That WS-23 and mint from the Cucumber Mint complement each other so well. The iciness doesn’t drown out the flavor. 2% TFA Honeydew is about my limit for that stuff and it can be a bully, but it’s not pushing out the cucumber, which is surprising. It actually seems to be amplifying it vs. Cucumber Mint as a single flavor. All of these flavors work together beautifully. The only thing I can really say by way of criticism is that I’m not convinced 0.1% TFA Peppermint is actually doing anything at all here. It’s not a very strong flavor - 3 or 4% is not an unheard of amount for something like a peppermint ice cream. However, I haven’t tried it without it so I can’t say for sure that it isn’t doing anything.
